alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Lunenburg; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland, Prince Edward and northwestern Lunenburg Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pamplin City, or 7 miles southeast of Appomattox, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds 30 to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmville, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Darlington Heights, Rice, Green Bay, Prospect, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Briery, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, Kingsville, Elam, Pleasant Grove, Meherrin, Worsham and Briery Creek Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
